importantVotes.title: Charter Amendment - Lifetime Term Limits
importantVotes.description: Charter Amendment to change the current two-term limits for Mayor and Board of Supervisors from consecutive term limits to lifetime term limits. An amendment was proposed to also impose lifetime limits on Assessor-Recorder, City Attorney, District Attorney, Public Defender, Sheriff, and Treasurer. The amendment FAILED.

importantVotes.title: Condemning ICE, Reaffirming Sanctuary City
importantVotes.description: Resolution condemning Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) for actions that have led to loss of life; urging state and federal partners to call for a third-party investigation on all deaths as a result of ICE actions; calling for a moratorium on ICE detention until investigation and corrective action; reaffirming San Francisco's commitment to Sanctuary City policies.

importantVotes.title: Settlement - City Tree Wrongful Death - $6M
importantVotes.description: Ordinance authorizing settlement of the lawsuit filed by Stephanie York, James Edward Brown, and Kayla Briers against the City for $6,030,000. The lawsuit involves alleged personal injury and wrongful death caused by a City tree.

importantVotes.title: Settlement - General Motors Tax Refund - $71M
importantVotes.description: Ordinance authorizing settlement of the lawsuit filed by General Motors Company against the City for $71,125,000. The lawsuit involves a claim for refund of gross receipts taxes, homelessness gross receipts taxes, overpaid executive gross receipts taxes, penalties, and interest.

importantVotes.title: Airport Revenue Bonds - $9 Billion
importantVotes.description: Ordinance appropriating $9,016,051,176 of proceeds from the sale of revenue bonds or commercial paper for capital improvement projects to the Airport Commission for FY2025-2026.

importantVotes.title: GO Bonds - Earthquake Safety - $535M for June Ballot
importantVotes.description: Resolution declaring public interest and necessity for construction, acquisition, improvement, rehabilitation of Emergency Firefighting Water System, Fire/Police Facilities, Muni Bus Storage at Potrero Yard, and other Public Safety Infrastructure. Authorizes $535,000,000 general obligation bonds for the June 2, 2026 election.

importantVotes.title: Koshland Park Improvement Grant - $1.6M
importantVotes.description: Resolution authorizing Recreation and Park Department to accept and expend cash and in-kind grants from Trust for Public Land and the Theodore & Frances Geballe Philanthropic Fund, valued at approximately $1,625,000 for design, installation, repair and construction of improvements to Koshland Park.

importantVotes.title: Stonestown Infrastructure Financing District
importantVotes.description: Resolution approving the Infrastructure Financing Plan for the San Francisco Enhanced Infrastructure Financing District No. 2 (Stonestown), including division of taxes, an EIFD Acquisition and Financing Agreement, and authorizing filing of a judicial validation action.

importantVotes.title: 3333 California St Infrastructure Financing District
importantVotes.description: Resolution approving the Infrastructure Financing Plan for the San Francisco Enhanced Infrastructure Financing District No. 3 (3333/3700 California Street), including division of taxes, an EIFD Acquisition and Financing Agreement, and authorizing filing of a judicial validation action.
